DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Clearance Or Glomerular Filtration Rate Eligibility Determination Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a medical procedure was performed that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine clearance or glomerular filtration rate to determine if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Clearance Or Glomerular Filtration Rate Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Creatinine Clearance Or Glomerular Filtration Rate Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Creatinine clearance ≥60 mL/min or glomerular filtration rate ≥60 mL/min/1.73m2?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance ≥60 mL/min or glomerular filtration rate ≥60 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min or glomerular filtration rate greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC22053
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a normal GFR (glomerular filtration rate).

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is GFR greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73m2 within 16 weeks prior to pre-entry?
